name: linear_regression_longitudinal
desc: Linear Regression for longitudinal data. The user selects a pair of visits and a strategy for each variable and covariate. A non-longitudinal dataset is then created from these parameters and an ordinary Linear Regression is run.
label: Linear Regression for longitudinal data

x.label: Covariates (independent)
x.desc: One or more variables. Can be numerical or nominal. For nominal variables dummy encoding is used.

visit1.label: 1st visit
visit1.desc: Can be chosen among BL (baseline), FL1 (follow-up1), FL2, FL3 or FL4.

visit2.label: 2nd visit
visit2.desc: Can be chosen among BL (baseline), FL1 (follow-up1), FL2, FL3 or FL4.

strategies.label: Strategies
strategies.desc: The strategies can be: 'diff': Compute the difference between the second and first visits, 'first': Keep value on first visit, 'second': Keep value on second visit.
